attributes.action: Get a national recognition for the responsibilities vehicle technicians hold
attributes.additional_details: The Motor Trade has to be the most poorly paid professions there is, and yet we’re the one dealing with something that over 77% of the uk’s population own and use every day. Us as technicians have no room for error, every single day we have people’s lives in our hands, yet we’re paid a poor wage for such responsibility.
attributes.background: Recognise the stress and consequences that apply to our role, and accept that the pay nationally for this trade is unacceptable

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about pay for vehicle technicians - provided these are consistent with national minimum wage legislation - are a matter for individual employers, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
